projects.title: Live Collaboration Docs
projects.description: Under construction! A real-time collaborative document editor built with TypeScript, Next.js, and Yjs. This application allows multiple users to edit documents simultaneously, with changes synchronized in real-time using WebSocket and WEBRTC technologies. The interface is styled with TailwindCSS for a clean and responsive user experience. Complete with offline support and Google Calendar integration for seamless scheduling and collaboration.

projects.title: Minecraft
projects.description: A simplified 3D Minecraft clone built with JavaScript and Three.js, allowing players to explore a blocky world, mine resources, and build structures. This project demonstrates fundamental game development concepts, user input handling, and basic simulation.

projects.title: Crossy road
projects.description: Inspired by the popular mobile game Crossy Road, this 3D endless runner game challenges players to navigate a character across busy roads while avoiding traffic. Built using Three.js for 3D rendering and TypeScript for robust game logic, the game features simple controls and endless gameplay.

A web-based version of the classic 2048 game, developed using TypeScript and React for a seamless user experience. The game features a responsive design with TailwindCSS, allowing players to enjoy the addictive tile-merging gameplay on any device.

projects.title: Fractal shader
projects.description: A mesmerizing fractal shader created with WGSL and TypeScript, showcasing intricate patterns and vibrant colors. This project explores the mathematical beauty of fractals through real-time rendering, allowing users to interactively explore the infinite complexity of fractal designs.

projects.title: P1 monitor
projects.description: An ESP32-based energy monitor that reads data from a smart meter's P1 port and sends it to a Supabase backend for storage and analysis. This open-source project utilizes C++ for firmware development and provides an efficient solution for tracking energy consumption in real-time.

projects.title: Audio visualizer
projects.description: A web-based audio visualizer that creates dynamic and colorful visual effects in response to music playback. Built using JavaScript and the Web Audio API, this project analyzes audio frequencies and generates real-time graphics that sync with the rhythm and intensity of the sound.

projects.title: GrannyB Recipes
projects.description: A recipe website built with TypeScript and Next.js, featuring a collection of family recipes. The site utilizes TailwindCSS for styling and offers a user-friendly interface for browsing, searching, and viewing detailed recipe instructions.

projects.title: Kings and pigs
projects.description: A small 2D side-scrolling game developed using JavaScript and the HTML5 Canvas API. Players control a character navigating through levels filled with obstacles, showcasing basic game mechanics and user interaction.
